title: "How can group coaching help improve team dynamics and achieve permanent change?"
first_phrase: This text provides practical insights on group coaching techniques and tools to improve team performance. In the previous chapters, topics such as conflict resolution and practical elements of coaching for groups were explored. In the final section, the focus shifts towards the role and language of an excellent coach, and the importance of coaching models in effective communication. Specific linguistic structures and phrases for different types of coaching sessions are discussed in detail, along with the word choice of a coach. The text ends with a comprehensive overview of coaching models and their semantic parts.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the elements and syntax of group coaching, as well as how to involve the group, frequent phenomena to utilize for group development, and the role transfer onto the coach are essential in creating an excellent coach. The linguistic and non-linguistic characteristics utilized in coaching language can prove to be effective in achieving permanent change and positively impacting collaborators.
